name: Zakopane
fun_fact: Fun fact: Zakopane is the heart of G贸rale (Highlander) culture, where traditional shepherds still make oscypek cheese using 15th-century techniques in mountain huts. The cheese is smoked for up to 14 days and has EU Protected Designation of Origin status!

hero_dishes.name: Oscypek Cheese
hero_dishes.description: Smoked sheep's milk cheese with a chewy, almost rubbery texture similar to halloumi. Shaped like decorative Christmas baubles with intricate patterns.
hero_dishes.origin_story: Dating back to the 15th century, oscypek was created by Goral shepherds in mountain pastures ('halas') as a way to preserve milk during summer grazing. Takes 7 liters of sheep's milk to make one 600-800g piece.
hero_dishes.where_to_find: Sold on charcoal BBQ grills all along Krup贸wki Street, served hot with cranberry sauce on cardboard with a toothpick. Look for authentic oscypek with EU Protected Designation (not just 'serki g贸ralskie')

hero_dishes.name: Kwanica (Sour Cabbage Soup)
hero_dishes.description: Intensely sour and salty soup made with pickled cabbage and meat (mutton or pork, often smoked ribs). On Poland's List of Traditional Products.
hero_dishes.origin_story: A warming highlander staple designed to fuel shepherds through harsh mountain winters. The intense flavor comes from fermented cabbage and slow-cooked mountain meats.
hero_dishes.where_to_find: Traditional highland restaurants throughout Zakopane, especially during winter months when it's most popular

hero_dishes.name: Placki Ziemniaczane (Mountain Potato Pancakes)
hero_dishes.description: Potato pancakes topped with wild chanterelle or forest mushroom sauce (in summer) or rich meat goulash. Served folded in half with sour cream.
hero_dishes.origin_story: In the Podhale mountain region, potato pancakes evolved beyond simple preparations to feature local forest mushrooms and hearty highland-style goulash.
hero_dishes.where_to_find: Local highland restaurants; look for seasonal chanterelle versions in summer, Hungarian-style pork goulash year-round

signature_drinks.name: Herbata G贸ralska (Highlander Tea)
signature_drinks.description: Mountain tea 'with electricity' - black tea mixed with vodka in 1:2 ratio (1 part tea, 2 parts vodka), often with sugar and lemon.
signature_drinks.how_locals_drink_it: Also called 'herbata z prdem' (tea with shocks/current). Popular at mountain huts and after skiing. Originally 2 parts vodka to 1 part tea for warmth in the mountains

signature_drinks.name: Mulled Wine
signature_drinks.description: Hot spiced wine served at cozy taverns and mountain lodges, perfect after a day skiing in the Tatras.
signature_drinks.how_locals_drink_it: Enjoyed at taverns throughout Zakopane, especially during winter. Part of the apr猫s-ski culture in the mountain resort town
